intro: Andrographis serpyllifolia, commonly known as common groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture and produces small, yellowish-green flowers in clusters. It thrives in a variety of soil types and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Its botanical characteristics make it a common weed in many regions.
